name: Legacy Falcon Hotel

reviews.text: Only stayed here for one night, stayed in a twin room. Rooms have been freshly renovated and are very large clean and bright. Good location, really nice breakfast i would definatley stay again !
reviews.title: Really nice Hotel

likes.liked: — The Clean and Big bright rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Main reason for stay was the New Year's Eve dinner dance planned by hotel. It was well organised and enjoyable started at 7.30 p.m with champagne/canapes and lasted till 2 a.m. Staff did well , service was efficient and friendly , food good, excellent cheeseboard
reviews.title: excellent new years eve party

likes.liked: — The New Year's eve dinner/dance / car park facility
likes.disliked: — Possibly because it was in the holiday season and staff might have been few in numbers room was not made up until early afternoon

reviews.text: Room had been recently refurbished /decorated in a functional rather than luxurious manner, good size but my wife missed the box of paper tissues you now get in most hotels and also did not like the toilet paper which she felt was not soft and gentle on the skin!
reviews.title: Almost perfect!

likes.disliked: — It was kept too hot, but one could turn off the radiator in the bedroom but the bathroom was HOT all the time

description: The Legacy Falcon Hotel comprises a quintessential 16th century residence featuring decorative half-timbering and original slanted windows totally encapsulating Tudor charm whilst harmonising with the contemporary bedrooms and stunning reception areas. Relax in front of real open fires during the autumn and winter or sample a traditional afternoon tea or delicious Ice-cream in the beautiful courtyard garden in the spring and summer. Providing a unique base for exploring everything magical about the bard including; Anne Hathaway's Cottage, Nash’s House and Shakespeare's birthplace itself, not forgetting the world famous Royal Shakespeare Company Theatre which now offers backstage tours and the opportunity to view Stratford from the new observation tower. You can then enjoy the beautiful Warwickshire countryside, along with the Surrounding counties of Oxfordshire, Worcestershire and Gloucestershire, and the picturesque Cotswolds. If you prefer, you can stay Stratford based, take a gentle stroll to the river and enjoy a tranquil trip on one of the river cruises, visit the Butterfly Farm or Creaky Cauldron attractions. To learn more about Stratford upon Avon and its history take a guided town walk or the evening Ghost Walk! For those who wish to explore a little further, the splendid Warwick Castle, Drayton Manor Theme Park and Gaydon Motor Museum are all within easy reach.
